sentiment_score_definition: x <= -0.35: Bearish; -0.35 < x <= -0.15: Somewhat-Bearish; -0.15 < x < 0.15: Neutral; 0.15 <= x < 0.35: Somewhat_Bullish; x >= 0.35: Bullish
relevance_score_definition: 0 < x <= 1, with a higher score indicating higher relevance.

feed.title: DocGo Inc. (NASDAQ:DCGO) Given Consensus Rating of "Hold" by Brokerages
feed.summary: DocGo Inc. (NASDAQ:DCGO) has received a consensus "Hold" rating from seven brokerages, with an average 12-month price target of $3.21. The company's shares are currently trading around $0.91, and it reported a recent quarterly EPS of ($0.11) which missed estimates, though revenue of $70.8 million slightly beat expectations. Institutional investors have recently adjusted their positions in DocGo, with entities like Millennium Management LLC significantly increasing their holdings.

feed.title: DocGo Inc. (NASDAQ:DCGO) Receives Average Recommendation of "Hold" from Brokerages
feed.summary: DocGo Inc. (NASDAQ:DCGO) has received a consensus "Hold" recommendation from brokerages, with an average 12-month target price of $3.21. The company reported a quarterly EPS of ($0.11), missing estimates, and posted $70.81M in revenue, but remains unprofitable with a negative net margin and a P/E of -1.75. DocGo's shares opened at $0.91, with a market capitalization of approximately $88.9M, indicating low valuation and significant stock volatility.

feed.title: Halper Sadeh LLC Encourages DocGo Inc. Shareholders to Contact the Firm to Discuss Their Rights
feed.summary: Halper Sadeh LLC, an investor rights law firm, is investigating whether officers and directors of DocGo Inc. (NASDAQ: DCGO) breached their fiduciary duties to long-term shareholders. The firm encourages current DocGo shareholders to contact them to discuss potential legal rights and options, including seeking corporate governance reforms or the return of funds to the company. The investigation aims to enhance shareholder value through improved company policies and oversight.

feed.title: Claim your share of the $12.5M DocGo securities class action settlement
feed.summary: Investors who purchased DocGo Inc. common stock between November 5, 2021, and September 15, 2023, may be eligible to claim a portion of a $12.5 million securities class action settlement. The lawsuit alleged DocGo and its CEO made false and misleading statements, particularly regarding the CEO's educational background and the company's Medicaid enrollment practices for asylum seekers. The deadline to file a claim is March 9, 2026, with an estimated payout of $0.12 per share before deductions.

feed.title: Robbins Geller Rudman & Dowd LLP Announces Proposed Settlement in the DocGo Securities Litigation
feed.summary: Robbins Geller Rudman & Dowd LLP announced a proposed settlement in the DocGo Securities Litigation, a class action lawsuit, for $12.5 million in cash. The settlement resolves all claims for individuals who purchased DocGo Inc. common stock between November 5, 2021, and September 15, 2023. A hearing to approve the settlement will be held on March 24, 2026, and class members must submit a Proof of Claim by March 9, 2026, to share in the distribution.

feed.title: DocGo stock repurchase program extended by board to June 2026
feed.summary: DocGo's Board of Directors has approved an extension to its share repurchase program, pushing the expiry date from December 31, 2025, to June 30, 2026. The company, trading near its 52-week low, has $26 million remaining in the program, potentially allowing it to repurchase approximately 8% of its outstanding shares. This extension comes amidst a significant decline in Q3 2025 revenue and an EPS miss, though analysts like Stifel and Cantor Fitzgerald maintain positive ratings.

feed.title: DocGo extends share repurchase program expiration to June 2026
feed.summary: DocGo Inc. (NASDAQ:DCGO) has extended its share repurchase program's expiration date from December 31, 2025, to June 30, 2026, with no other changes to its terms. This program allows DocGo to buy back up to $26 million in common stock, which represents a significant portion of its $90.3 million market cap. The extension suggests management views the stock as undervalued, despite a recent Q3 2025 EPS and revenue miss.

feed.title: DocGo extends share repurchase program expiration to June 2026
feed.summary: DocGo Inc. has extended its share repurchase program's expiration date from December 31, 2025, to June 30, 2026, with no other changes to its terms. The program allows the company to buy back up to $26 million in common stock, representing a significant portion of its $90.3 million market cap. This comes amidst recent financial challenges, including a Q3 2025 EPS and revenue miss, while analysts from Stifel, Canaccord Genuity, and Cantor Fitzgerald have reiterated ratings with varying price targets.

feed.title: DocGo Extends Share Repurchase Program to 2026
feed.summary: DocGo (DCGO) has extended its share repurchase program until June 30, 2026, allowing the company to buy back up to $26 million in common stock. This move aims to provide flexibility in managing its capital structure and support stock price stability, signaling confidence in its financial health. TipRanks’ AI Analyst, Spark, rates DCGO as Neutral due to financial performance challenges and bearish technical trends.

feed.title: HALPER SADEH LLC ENCOURAGES DOCGO INC. SHAREHOLDERS TO CONTACT THE FIRM TO DISCUSS THEIR RIGHTS
feed.summary: Halper Sadeh LLC, an investor rights law firm, is investigating whether certain officers and directors of DocGo Inc. (NASDAQ: DCGO) breached their fiduciary duties to shareholders. The firm encourages long-term DocGo shareholders to contact them to learn about potential legal rights and options, including corporate governance reforms or financial incentives. Halper Sadeh LLC handles these actions on a contingent fee basis.

feed.title: HALPER SADEH LLC ENCOURAGES DOCGO INC. SHAREHOLDERS TO CONTACT THE FIRM TO DISCUSS THEIR RIGHTS
feed.summary: Halper Sadeh LLC, an investor rights law firm, is investigating whether officers and directors of DocGo Inc. (NASDAQ: DCGO) breached their fiduciary duties to shareholders. The firm encourages long-term shareholders to contact them to discuss potential corporate governance reforms, recovery of funds, or other benefits. Shareholder involvement is highlighted as crucial for improving company practices and enhancing shareholder value.

feed.title: DocGo Acquires Virtual Care Platform SteadyMD | Findhelp Acquires Uno Health | Vatica Health has Merged with Cozeva
feed.summary: DocGo has acquired virtual care platform SteadyMD to expand its telehealth services across all 50 states, expecting SteadyMD to generate $25 million in revenue in 2025. Findhelp acquired Uno Health to create a full-stack platform for benefit enrollment and social care coordination. Vatica Health merged with Cozeva, combining their #1-rated risk adjustment and quality platforms to enhance value-based care enablement.

feed.title: DocGo Inc. (NASDAQ:DCGO) Receives Average Recommendation of "Hold" from Brokerages
feed.summary: DocGo Inc. (NASDAQ:DCGO) has received a consensus "Hold" rating from seven brokerage firms, with an average 12-month target price of $3.2125. The company's shares are trading around $1.03, significantly below its 52-week high, and it continues to be unprofitable, missing recent EPS estimates. Despite the "Hold" recommendation, institutional investors have recently increased their stakes, with notable buys from Jefferies, P.A.W. Capital, and Millennium, bringing institutional ownership to about 56.44%.

feed.title: DocGo Announces Participation at Upcoming December Investor Conferences
feed.summary: DocGo Inc. (Nasdaq: DCGO) has announced that its CEO, Lee Bienstock, will be participating in several investor conferences in December. These include the Noble Capital Markets Emerging Growth Conference, Citi’s 2025 Global Healthcare Conference, and the iAccess Alpha Best Ideas Conference, where he will engage in 1x1 meetings and deliver presentations. Webcasts of the Noble Capital Markets and iAccess Alpha presentations will be available on DocGo’s investor relations website.

feed.title: DocGo Announces Participation at Upcoming Investor Conferences
feed.summary: DocGo Inc. announced that its management will be attending several investor conferences in November. CFO Norm Rosenberg will participate in the 17th Annual Southwest Ideas Conference and both CEO Lee Bienstock and Rosenberg will be at the Canaccord Genuity Medtech, Diagnostics and Digital Health & Services Forum and Needham Sixth Annual Tech Week. CEO Lee Bienstock will also engage in the BTIG Digital Health Forum.

feed.title: DocGo Acquires Virtual Care Platform SteadyMD, Expands Telehealth Services Across All 50 States
feed.summary: DocGo Inc. has acquired virtual care platform SteadyMD, expanding its telehealth services across all 50 states. This strategic acquisition combines DocGo's mobile healthcare delivery capabilities with SteadyMD's virtual care platform, which is projected to generate approximately $25 million in revenue in 2025 and be EBITDA positive by 2026. The acquisition aims to enhance accessibility to high-quality healthcare by integrating virtual and mobile care services.

feed.title: DOCGO INVESTIGATION CONTINUED by Former Louisiana Attorney General: Kahn Swick & Foti, LLC Continues to Investigate the Officers and Directors of DocGo Inc. - DCGO
feed.summary: Kahn Swick & Foti, LLC (KSF) is continuing its investigation into DocGo Inc. (NasdaqCM: DCGO) concerning potential breaches of fiduciary duties by its officers and directors. This follows news reports in September 2023 alleging misrepresentations regarding a $4 billion contract with U.S. Customs and Border Protection, which was reportedly worth less, and issues with the CEO's educational background, leading to a securities class action lawsuit. A court recently denied DocGo's motion to dismiss parts of the lawsuit, allowing the case to proceed.

feed.title: DocGo: Revenue Collapse Overshadows Acquisition, Is Cheap But Still A Hold (NASDAQ:DCGO)
feed.summary: DocGo's revenue significantly declined in 2025 due to the loss of a major New York contract, highlighting customer concentration risks. While the acquisition of SteadyMD introduces telehealth capabilities, it faces strong competition, and operating losses have widened. Despite a distressed valuation and negative full-year EBITDA guidance, insider buying and extremely low valuation metrics support a "Hold" rather than a "Sell" stance.

feed.title: DocGo acquires SteadyMD for up to $25M
feed.summary: DocGo has acquired telehealth provider SteadyMD for up to $25 million. This strategic move aims to enhance DocGo's healthcare services, specifically within its Health Tech division. The acquisition was announced on October 21, 2025.

feed.title: 10,000 Members: DocGo Launches Care Gap Closure in New Mexico, Plans Primary Care Services - Stock Titan
feed.summary: DocGo Inc. (Nasdaq: DCGO) is launching a care gap closure program in New Mexico to enhance healthcare access for 10,000 Turquoise Care enrollees, expanding its partnership with a national insurance provider. This initiative will facilitate at-home care, including well-child visits, vaccinations, and chronic disease assessments, with plans to introduce primary care services to reengage patients with their health. The program aims to overcome historical barriers to healthcare access by leveraging mobile clinicians and technology to provide care directly to patients.

feed.title: DocGo Signs Deal to Launch Care Gap Closure Program in New Mexico With National Insurance Provider - The Joplin Globe
feed.summary: DocGo Inc. has signed a deal to launch a care gap closure program in New Mexico with a national insurance provider, aiming to enhance healthcare access for 10,000 Turquoise Care enrollees. The program leverages DocGo's mobile health services to provide at-home care, including well-child visits, vaccinations, and assessments for hypertension and diabetes control, and plans to introduce primary care services. This initiative, highlighted by DocGo's CEO and Clinical Practice Group CEO, seeks to remove barriers to care and improve health outcomes by meeting patients where they are.

feed.title: Benign Growth For DocGo Inc. (NASDAQ:DCGO) Underpins Its Share Price
feed.summary: DocGo Inc. currently trades at a low price-to-sales (P/S) ratio of 0.3x, significantly below the industry average of 1.4x, due to recent revenue declines and a negative future outlook. Analysts project a 27% decrease in revenue for DocGo next year, contrasting with an expected 8.7% growth for the broader Healthcare industry. This weak performance and uncertain growth trajectory are seen as the primary reasons for its depressed P/S ratio, making a significant stock price increase unlikely without a material change in its financial trajectory.

feed.title: Mobile Health Leader DocGo Announces Executive Presentations at Three Major Healthcare Conferences
feed.summary: DocGo Inc. (Nasdaq: DCGO) announced that its management will participate in three upcoming investor conferences in August and September. CFO Norm Rosenberg will present at the Three Part Advisors Midwest Conference, while CEO Lee Bienstock will hold 1x1 meetings and participate in fireside chats at the Cantor Global Healthcare Conference and the Morgan Stanley 23rd Annual Global Healthcare Conference. Webcasts for these events will be available on DocGo's investor relations website.

feed.title: DocGo Can't Nix Investor Suit Over 'Indisputably False' Claims
feed.summary: A New York federal judge has allowed parts of a proposed class action against mobile medical provider DocGo to proceed, ruling that claims stemming from the former CEO's "indisputably false" statements can move forward. The lawsuit alleges that DocGo and its leadership misled stockholders regarding its $432 million migrant-services contract with New York City before public scrutiny. While some claims were trimmed, those based on the CEO's false statements remain active.

feed.title: DocGo: I'm Still On The Fence On This One (NASDAQ:DCGO)
feed.summary: DocGo's shares have significantly declined following its Q4 '24 report, reflecting a past reliance on contingent revenue sources like COVID-19 testing. The company is transitioning towards health insurance partnerships for more stable revenue, but faces high competition and a history of weak operational profitability. Despite these negatives, the author considers the shares a "hold" due to reasonable valuation and insider buying.

feed.title: Ambulnz by DocGo Launches Emergency Medical Services in Dover, Delaware
feed.summary: DocGo Inc.'s subsidiary, Ambulnz, has launched emergency medical and 911 services in Dover, Delaware, starting July 1, 2024. This three-year contract, awarded through a competitive bidding process, expands DocGo's existing work in Dover where it has supported the Bayhealth hospital system since January 2022. The new services involve 24/7 basic life support ambulances operating out of three stations and are supported by over 50 EMS field professionals.

feed.title: DCGO Stock Price and Chart — NASDAQ:DCGO
feed.summary: This article provides a comprehensive overview of DocGo Inc. (DCGO) stock performance, key financial metrics, and analyst insights. It covers current stock price, historical performance, upcoming earnings, company information, and potential investment ideas, along with frequently asked questions.

feed.title: Exclusive | No-bid migrant contractor DocGo’s successor set to reap $450M in NYC taxpayer money
feed.summary: A disaster response company, Garner Environmental Services, that replaced the controversial migrant services provider DocGo in New York City, is projected to cost taxpayers over $450 million. Councilman Justin Brannan has called for an investigation into Garner's contract, arguing it significantly exceeds DocGo's criticized $432 million deal without sufficient scrutiny. Garner representatives state they offer more cost-effective services, while Brannan alleges the company exploited public hospital systems with inflated security staff rates.

feed.title: DocGo Appoints Eiwe Lingefors as New Chief Information Officer
feed.summary: DocGo Inc. has appointed Eiwe Lingefors as its new Chief Information Officer (CIO). Lingefors, previously the Chief Information Security Officer, will now also lead the company's digital innovation strategy, focusing on enhancing cybersecurity and patient data protection. This appointment underscores DocGo's commitment to strengthening its technology and security foundations to advance its proactive healthcare mission.

feed.title: DocGo says hackers stole patient data in a recent cyberattack
feed.summary: Mobile medical services provider DocGo has disclosed a cyberattack that compromised a limited number of healthcare records from its US-based ambulance transportation business. The company states that the incident has not had a material impact on its operations or financial condition and that it has contained the unauthorized activity. This incident highlights the heightened adversary activities targeting the healthcare sector, as seen in recent attacks on Change Healthcare and NextGen Healthcare.

feed.title: DocGo Says Patient Data Stolen in Recent Cyberattack
feed.summary: DocGo, a provider of mobile medical services, announced a cyberattack resulted in the theft of patient data from its ambulance transportation business. The breach was contained, and a third-party cybersecurity firm is assisting with the investigation, with DocGo stating no significant financial impact. Separately, Bridgeway Center, Inc. reported a cyberattack affecting the personal and protected health information of over 65,000 individuals.

feed.title: NYC and DocGo to Part Ways After Migrant Service Operator’s Contract Ends
feed.summary: New York City is ending its $432 million contract with DocGo, a medical services provider that had been housing and caring for migrants, effective early May. The decision comes after DocGo faced allegations of mistreating migrants, providing false papers, wasting food, and hiring unlicensed security guards. Garner Environmental Services will temporarily take over services in NYC at a lower cost, while DocGo's upstate contract may be extended to avoid disruption.

feed.title: DocGo and EmblemHealth Launch Partnership to Bring In-Home Care to Patients
feed.summary: DocGo and EmblemHealth have partnered to launch a program bringing in-home healthcare services to patients in New York and Connecticut, particularly focusing on post-hospitalization care and preventive screenings. This collaboration aims to reduce hospital readmissions, lower costs, and improve health outcomes by making care more accessible and addressing health disparities. The initiative expands DocGo's services into Connecticut and supports EmblemHealth's mission to provide quality, accessible healthcare.

feed.title: DocGo CEO steps down as New York attorney general's office, NYC officials probe company's migrant health services
feed.summary: DocGo CEO Anthony Capone has resignedamid increasing scrutiny from New York authorities regarding the company's migrant healthcare services contract with New York City, and allegations about his educational background. The company, which received a $432 million no-bid contract, is being investigated by the NY Attorney General's office and audited by the NYC Comptroller following concerns over its performance and vendor selection process. Lee Bienstock, former President and COO, has assumed the CEO role.

feed.title: Troubled Migrant Contractor Faces Investigation Into Possible Wrongdoing (Published 2023)
feed.summary: The New York State Attorney General is investigating DocGo, a medical services company contracted by New York City to manage migrant services, over allegations of misleading migrants, making threats, and enrolling them in ineligible healthcare plans. Migrants have reported being deceived and mistreated by the company, which previously focused on COVID-19 services. DocGo has stated it will cooperate with the attorney general's request for information.

feed.title: DocGo to Exhibit Innovative Vehicles at 2022 Subway Series Mets vs. Yankees Game in NYC
feed.summary: DocGo (Nasdaq: DCGO) announced it will showcase its industry-first all-electric ambulance and the prototype "Hoverlance" at Citi Field during the Mets vs. Yankees Subway Series on July 27, 2022. These innovative vehicles represent DocGo's commitment to advancing mobile health services and emergency response capabilities. The exhibition will take place starting at 5:00 p.m. and will include giveaways for visitors.

feed.title: DocGo Unveils the Nation’s First All-Electric, Zero-Emissions Ambulance
feed.summary: DocGo has unveiled the nation's first all-electric, zero-emissions ambulance, marking a significant step towards their "Zero Emission" sustainability initiative to have an all-electric fleet by 2032. This eco-friendly vehicle, developed in partnership with Lightning eMotors, is significantly less polluting and has the potential to lower patient transportation costs. The company will be hosting a ribbon-cutting event in New York to celebrate the first patient transport in this innovative ambulance.

feed.title: DocGo Aims to Deliver Cost-Efficient Medical Care
feed.summary: DocGo, a mobile health care provider, is leveraging its model to deliver cost-efficient medical care by deploying EMTs, paramedics, and nurses for services traditionally performed by doctors. The company, which went public in 2021, focuses on optimizing working capital, managing operating costs, and replacing COVID-testing revenue with new contracts, particularly with municipalities. DocGo sees mobile health as a disruptive force in healthcare, similar to past upheavals in the telecom industry.

feed.title: These innovative projects are changing the health industry
feed.summary: Fast Company's 2022 World Changing Ideas Awards highlights innovative projects in the health industry, categorized into finalists and honorable mentions. These innovations are recognized for their potential to save lives, extend longevity, or increase access to care. The article lists numerous companies and their projects, spanning AI-powered modules, brain implants, genetic mapping, and various health-tech solutions.

feed.title: DocGo, Lightning eMotors unveil all-electric ambulance
feed.summary: DocGo and Lightning eMotors have partnered to deliver the first all-electric, zero-emissions ambulance in the U.S. This initiative is part of DocGo's "Zero Emission" mission to achieve an all-electric fleet by 2032. The electric ambulance is significantly less polluting and offers the potential for lower patient transportation costs due to reduced fuel and maintenance needs.

feed.title: Mobile health services provider DocGo goes public via SPAC
feed.summary: DocGo, a mobile health services provider, has gone public via a SPAC. DocGo President Anthony Capone highlighted that the company delivers healthcare "where it's needed, when it's needed," serving various locations including homes, cruises, and correctional facilities.

feed.title: On the heels of going public, DocGo aims to expand mobile medical services in the U.S. and overseas
feed.summary: DocGo, formerly Ambulnz, went public via a SPAC merger with Motion Acquisition Corp., valuing the company at $1.1 billion. The company plans to use the $158 million raised to expand its mobile health services geographically and through M&A opportunities, both domestically and internationally, including a direct-to-consumer pilot program. DocGo differentiates itself by using licensed/certified EMTs, paramedics, and LPNs to provide cost-effective "last-mile" healthcare services.

feed.title: Motion Acquisition Corp. and DocGo Announce Closing of Business Combination, will Begin Trading on Nasdaq Under the Symbol "DCGO"
feed.summary: DocGo, Inc., a mobile health and medical mobility solutions provider, announced the completion of its business combination with Motion Acquisition Corp. Effective November 8, 2021, DocGo's common stock and warrants will trade on Nasdaq under the symbols "DCGO" and "DCGOW" respectively. This merger raised approximately $158 million in cash proceeds for DocGo, which the company plans to use for geographic expansion in its Mobile Health services.
